translation.en: [narrator] It's been over 75 years

translation.en: the start of which coincided with the most deadly period in human history.

The Cold War.
At some point, perhaps when this problem with the Soviet Union was resolved
and we got on the same page and was like, oh, okay, great,
translation.ko: 서로의 의견에 동의하게 됐을 때 '그래, 좋아'

You helped win the war. Let's work together. That didn't happen.

translation.en: What happened was trillions and trillions of modern dollars

Then nuclear submarines,
putting them on tracks, putting them on launchpads,
putting them underwater,
so that they could-- you could be dead 12 seconds after the war began.
translation.ko: 전쟁이 시작하면 12초 안에 죽을 수 있게요

translation.en: [narrator] Could we be on the verge of another deadly conflict?

translation.en: Events that raised a completely different kind of concern

translation.en: Projects which have remained top secret until now.
[narrator] June, 1947.
In the skies above Washington State, close to Mount Rainier,

translation.ko: 미확인 비행 물체 대형을 목격하고 보고했습니다

translation.en: Arnold's account led to the press

One month later, the most notorious UFO sighting in history occurred.
translation.ko: 한 달 후, 역사상 가장 악명높은 유에프오 목격 사건이 일어납니다

Major Jesse A. Marcel, Air Force Intelligence Officer,

Perhaps at its core, why it has really resonated throughout the years

translation.ko: 해리 트루먼이라면 그 정보를 어떻게 하겠어요?

first of all, you don't know, are they hostile or friendly.
Basically it's informally

translation.en: that press release out of Roswell Air Force Ba--, army air force base,

The very same day they hold a late press conference,

They get him in a room to hold up some Reynolds Wrap
translation.ko: 로저 레이미의 냉동실에 있던 생선 요리를 씌워 뒀을 법한

And, the press goes, "Oh, okay, right, no problem…"
[man] They debunked the whole thing and said,

I think initially they might have thought it was even a Russian weapon or something

translation.en: to cover-- that was for the referral cover up for the… [coughing]

The foundations were laid

Project Blue book was run by the United States Air Force

Starting in 1947 with Project Sign

Project Blue book was, I think a genuine attempt

translation.en: Because we have a case here, a lot of people say,

Washington, D.C.
We bring you the dramatic story

translation.ko: 윌리엄 패터슨 중위는 물체 중 하나를 목표로

The unknown objects tracked on the radar were moving at unbelievable speeds,

[Rojas] Project Blue Book investigators were ready

they took over the control tower

They saw the jets being scrambled,

It's an amazing episode of history

On July 29th, 1952,

The largest press conference since World War II was held at the Pentagon

We can say that the recent sightings are in no way connected

Sheppard Air Force Base back in 1966.

translation.en: does now have more, more credibility.
[Masters] The stigma was manufactured.
We as scientists were used in this divide and conquer tactic

translation.en: or dismiss any sort of encounter that somebody had.
[man] What are you doing there, Moe?

translation.en: [Moe] Just flying saucers.

translation.en: [Masters] What we see today, the stigma that still exists
in the separation between the UFO community

that was used by military and government in the 1940s, 50s and throughout.

translation.en: And that's not conspiracy theory.
[Dolan] When you keep encountering these objects

translation.en: that are over sensitive airspace that are not supposed to be there,

translation.en: you have to do something about it.

translation.en: And the thing is they tried to do it as quietly as they can,
translation.ko: 중요한 건, 그들은 최대한 감추려고 한다는 거죠

translation.en: but this has never stopped being a problem for the United States military.

translation.en: [narrator] Although the results of many years of observation

with UFOs having been successfully relegated to the sphere of pop culture,

translation.en: or has stopped being active in monitoring any activity

translation.en: which could be associated with UFOs.
[Pope] It put the United States government in a very difficult position
because for years, they had said in response to any questions about this,

translation.en: "We don't investigate UFOs anymore." "We haven't done this since Project Blue Book."
translation.ko: '우리는 프로젝트 블루 북 이후로 유에프오를 조사하지 않습니다'

translation.en: So, of course, this story proved that they had.
translation.ko: 그러니 이 이야기로 그들이 거짓말을 했다는 게 입증돼요

translation.en: So it was embarrassing.
[Hynek] The philosophical drive of Project Blue Book
was that UFOs did not exist.
So they're always looking for explanations like a weather balloon, the planet Saturn,
translation.ko: 그래서 항상 기상 관측 도구나 토성, 거짓말 등으로 설명할 수단을 찾아왔죠

translation.en: or a hoax to explain them away.
translation.ko: 토성, 거짓말 등으로 설명할 수단을 찾아왔죠

translation.en: I don't think it is space people,
although I would be delighted if it turned out that way,
because as an astronomer,
I think it would make astronomy even more interesting than it is.
translation.ko: 천문학이 이보다 훨씬 더 흥미로워졌을 거예요

translation.en: And as far as the Air Force is concerned, I can't speak for them of course,

translation.en: but I should imagine that if the existence of spacecraft were really established,
it would really increase the appropriations of the Air Force.
Project Blue Book was sort of the front man out there saying,
translation.ko: 프로젝트 블루 북은 이렇게 말하는 대외적인 간판 같았어요

translation.en: "Hey, don't worry. Nothing going on here. Don't look behind the curtain."
translation.ko: '걱정 마, 아무 일도 없어 커튼 뒤는 보지 말고'

translation.en: [Bassett] So they've been researching whatever they can research
translation.ko: 그들은 조사를 해 왔어요 외계 생명체에 대해 조사할 수 있는 건 뭐든요

translation.en: about the extraterrestrial presence, particularly the technology, 24/7,
translation.ko: 외계 생명체에 대해 조사할 수 있는 건 뭐든요 특히 기술에 관해서 매일 하루 24시간…

translation.en: uh, month after month, year after year, all the way back into the 50s.
And so this idea that, "Oh, they just did Blue Book and they didn't do anything."
translation.ko: 그러니 '블루 북 이후에 아무것도 안 했고'

translation.en: And then they came up with the ATIP program.
translation.ko: '그 후에 AATIP 프로그램을 만들어 냈다'는 생각은

translation.en: Believe me, they've been studying it all this time.
translation.ko: 절대 옳지 않아요 늘 연구해 온 게 분명합니다

translation.en: The idea that we have to classify and keep things secret and safe,
translation.ko: 기밀 사항으로 분류하고 비밀로 해야 한다는 생각 말이죠

translation.en: and, you know, we don't have the same level of existential threat we used to have.
translation.ko: 우리는 더는 예전 같은 실질적인 위협을 느끼지 않아요

translation.en: We just don't.
It's time to move on and say, "Look,
I'd rather have some of these secrets get out
and have a more open world and a lot stronger understanding
translation.ko: '더 넓은 세상을 보며' '우리가 지금 이해하는 것보다'

translation.en: than what we currently have."
